cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles E of Andros Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest, then turning north-northwest and paralleling the U.S. Southeast coast before accelerating northeastward toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of the Carolinas (near the SC/NC border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach FL to south of Boca Raton FL; Volusia/Flagler County Line FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton FL to Volusia/Flagler County Line FL (hurricane warning); portions of the Northwestern Bahamas (hurricane warning); North of Ocean Reef FL to south of Boca Raton FL and Lake Okeechobee (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida through New England, including the Mid-Atlantic shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty conditions possible Tuesday night into early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal rise possible along the Delaware River and upper Delaware Bay, but significant surge >3 ft is not anticipated
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated 6-inch pockets possible across the Philadelphia metro late Tuesday–Wednesday, leading to urban and poor-drainage flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief river flooding on tributaries, dangerous rip currents along nearby New Jersey and Delaware beaches
